verses.text: <a href="../2-Corinthians-12-1/" title="2 Corinthians 12:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1  "JESUS_END"It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-2/" title="2 Corinthians 12:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2  "JESUS_END"I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-3/" title="2 Corinthians 12:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3  "JESUS_END"And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-4/" title="2 Corinthians 12:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4  "JESUS_END"How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-5/" title="2 Corinthians 12:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5  "JESUS_END"Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

6 "JESUS_END"For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-7/" title="2 Corinthians 12:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7  "JESUS_END"And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-8/" title="2 Corinthians 12:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-9/" title="2 Corinthians 12:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9  "JESUS_END"And he said unto me, "JESUS_START" My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. "JESUS_END" Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-10/" title="2 Corinthians 12:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10  "JESUS_END"Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-11/" title="2 Corinthians 12:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11  "JESUS_END"I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-12/" title="2 Corinthians 12:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12  "JESUS_END"Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.
13 "JESUS_END"For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-14/" title="2 Corinthians 12:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14  "JESUS_END"Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-15/" title="2 Corinthians 12:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15  "JESUS_END"And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-16/" title="2 Corinthians 12:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16  "JESUS_END"But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-12-17/" title="2 Corinthians 12:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17  "JESUS_END"Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?
18 "JESUS_END"I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?
19 "JESUS_END"Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

20 "JESUS_END"For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

21 "JESUS_END"And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
